definition: to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]

sentences.english: He will draw me a picture.
Filling your frame with a repetitive pattern can give the impression of size and large numbers.
sentences.chinese: 将画幅中填满重复的图案可以营造体积和数字感。

sentences.english: Mrs. Flinders decided to have her portrait painted.
sentences.chinese: 弗林德斯太太决心请人给她画幅肖像画。

sentences.english: Noise reduction is first applied as the full-frame sensor converts light to electronic signals.
sentences.chinese: 降噪是首次应用于的全画幅传感器光转换为电信号。

sentences.english: Beautiful field is a picture itself.
sentences.chinese: 美丽的田野是天然的画幅。

sentences.english: This is why Zhao Dewei's works are done on such a grand scale.
sentences.chinese: 这也是为什么赵德伟的作品画幅较大。

sentences.english: I like small series of 2 or 3 square images on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢挂在墙上的小系列的二到三幅的方画幅图片。

definition: camera (abbr. for 照相機|照相机[zhao4 xiang4 ji1])/at the opportune moment/as the circumstances allow
see 單反相機|单反相机[dan1 fan3 xiang4 ji1]
rectangular frame used to view a scene (made out of cardboard etc, or formed by the thumbs and forefingers)/viewfinder/viewing frame
